vision.elevator_pitch: Stand is an operating system where kids can build actual businesses — like an old-school lemonade stand, modernized for today's kids and today's age. Schools teach theory, but kids are creative and want a sense of purpose and doing.
vision.success_6mo: Test with 100+ families through a closed pilot by mid-March. Gather live feedback on onboarding, product marketplace, and business types. Then launch the MVP to a few hundred founding Stand CEOs in LA for the summer.
vision.success_12mo: Prove product-market fit. Reach first 1,000 customers. Seasonal product drops, partnerships, and a community that makes kids want to keep coming back — not just a one-time thing.
vision.first_win: Seeing their brand come to life visually — the business card, the storefront preview, their name on products. The moment they realize "wow, I can actually do this." It needs to feel like magic, not like filling out a form.

current.built_today: Functional prototype built by Chris on Claude Code — Next.js/React on Supabase, deployed on Vercel. Has onboarding flow (interests → business idea → brand creation → parent approval via QR/email). Voice input was attempted. Some Figma work from Dennis on brand evolution. Original Stand brand/logo exists. Summer beta tested physical elements.
current.working_not_working:
What's working: The basic flow logic (interests → narrow → product → brand → pitch → launch). QR code for parent approval. The physical beta validated demand.

What's not working: Looks "vibe coded" — not branded or polished. Category selection is overwhelming (too many options). The reveal moment doesn't deliver excitement. Missing the magic/animation kids expect. Onboarding feels too long. Logo AI generation has quality/spelling issues. Design from Dennis feels AI-generated, missing soul.

business.real_money: No transactions - kids won't be handling money in the pilot

design.design_admire: Uncommon (unc.mn) — simplicity, clarity, Apple-esque. Tin Can (tincan.kids) — nostalgia modernized beautifully. Double Good — gamification, leaderboards, pop-up selling concept. Girl Scouts as a structural inspiration. Gaming aesthetics married with soul. Wes Anderson, 80s vibes, vintage tennis posters, badges made cool again, streetwear/hype.
